definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: She lost a handkerchief edged with blue.
sentences.chinese: 她丟了一塊鑲藍邊的手絹。

sentences.english: When Ch'in-wen took the handkerchiefs to Bamboo Lodge, Tai-yu had gone to bed.
sentences.chinese: 睛雯拿了手絹到瀟湘館時，黛玉已睡下了。

sentences.english: She fluttered her handkerchief from the train window as a goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 她在火車的窗口揮動着手絹道別。

sentences.english: I pulled the hatpin out and held my handkerchief over the bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 我把那針拔下來，用我的手絹捂住她流血的地方。

sentences.english: She lost a hand kerchiefedged with blue.
Small handkerchief, four square, a veil, hide and seek.
sentences.chinese: 小手絹，四方方，蒙上臉，捉迷藏。

sentences.english: Unless, that is, you agree willingly to let me do it again, and no handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 除非你心甘情願地讓我再吻一次，而且不許用手絹擦。

sentences.english: There were no white hankies, which showed that they were satisfied with the way their team played.
sentences.chinese: 沒有白手絹，這表示他們很滿意自己球隊的踢法。

sentences.english: Tied to her wrist was a fancy handkerchief embroidered with the words "Little Sister, I love you".
sentences.chinese: 腕上放着一塊白絲手絹，繡着“妹妹我愛你”。

sentences.english: We sold 4,000doz. Handkerchiefs of this description last month.
sentences.chinese: 上個月我們賣出4000打這種規格的手絹。

sentences.english: You need handkerchiefs, soap and a nail clipper.
sentences.chinese: 你需要手絹，肥皂和指甲刀。

sentences.english: She is waving a white handkerchief to her friends on the train.
sentences.chinese: 她正在火車上朝她的朋友們揮動一條白色的手絹。

sentences.english: Then he mopped his forehead with a handkerchief decorated with red squares.
sentences.chinese: 然後他拿一塊有紅方格子的手絹擦着額頭。

sentences.english: The minister took out his handkerchief and blew his nose sonorously.
sentences.chinese: 牧師掏出手絹，響亮地擤鼻涕。

sentences.english: I lost a white handkerchief with a blue border.
sentences.chinese: 我丟了一塊帶藍邊的白手絹。

definition: weight/pendant/same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]/ballad singing accompanied by a 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
felt-tip pen/roller ball pen/gel ink pen
